title: Asian stocks head for fourth weekly gains as tech shares climb
summary: Asian stocks are on track for their best weekly run since May. Technology shares are reaching new highs, driven by strong investor interest in artificial intelligence. This surge follows positive news from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company, boosting confidence in the tech sector. US and European markets also saw gains, with chipmakers performing exceptionally well.

title: BluPine raises Rs 5,400 cr loan underwritten by Axis Bank
summary: BluPine Energy, backed by Actis, has secured a significant ₹5,400 crore loan from Axis Bank. This long-term financing will support its renewable energy portfolio. The loan is secured against operating solar and wind assets. BluPine Energy is developing substantial renewable capacity in India. Proceeds will refinance existing borrowings, strengthening its financial position.

title: Stock Radar: Coal India stock breaks out from Ascending Triangle range to hit fresh 52-week high in January 2026; time to buy?
summary: Coal India stock has broken out of a bullish pattern on its charts. The stock reached a new 52-week high in January 2026. Experts suggest buying the stock now or on dips. The stock has shown strong momentum, rising over 12% in a month. Technical indicators support further upward movement. A target of Rs 500 is anticipated.

title: Moody's upgrades outlook for three key Adani Group firms
summary: Moody's Ratings has upgraded the outlook for three Adani Group companies to stable. Adani Ports, Adani Transmission Step-One, and Adani Electricity Mumbai now have a stable outlook. This reflects improved liquidity and strong financial profiles. The companies are expected to maintain sufficient liquidity for operations and debt obligations over the next 18 months.

title: Banks' credit-to-deposit ratio hits record 81.75% as mobilisation lags
summary: Indian banks' credit-to-deposit ratio hit an all-time high of 81.75% as of December 31, signaling pressure to attract deposits amid robust loan demand. This elevated ratio reflects challenges in deposit mobilization, with investors seeking higher returns elsewhere, and a lag in deposit growth compared to credit expansion.

title: China’s $1.2 trillion windfall quietly seeps into global markets
summary: China's record trade surplus is fueling massive private overseas investments, with companies and individuals now holding over $1 trillion in foreign assets. This shift from state control to private capital flows introduces risks of sudden reversals, especially with a strengthening yuan. The global financial system faces increased reliance on this Chinese-sourced liquidity.

title: China plans to stop subsidizing solar exports. Which Indian firms stand to benefit?
summary: China announced on 9 January that its rebates on photovoltaic products would be removed, and those on batteries would be cut from 9% to 6% starting 1 April 2026 before being phased out entirely by early 2027. This is potentially a bumper development for India’s solar exporters.

title: Wikipedia signs AI deal with Amazon, Meta, Microsoft and Perplexity on 25th anniversary: Here's what this means
summary: Online crowdsourced encyclopedia Wikipedia, on its 25th anniversary, announced it has signed artificial intelligence deals with companies including Amazon, Meta Platforms, Microsoft, Mistral AI, and Perplexity.

title: Mutual funds trim Paytm stake for first time since IPO; retail exits deepen. What’s next for investors?
summary: Mutual funds have reduced their stake in Paytm for the first time since its IPO, while retail investors continue to exit. Despite this, several brokerages have upgraded the stock, citing improving regulatory conditions, clearer earnings visibility, and growth potential in new segments. Analysts believe Paytm's strong merchant network and improving profitability metrics are key drivers for future upside

title: Angel One shares zoom over 7% after Q3 results, interim dividend, 1:10 stock split announcement
summary: On Friday, shares of Angel One soared as the company released its third-quarter earnings report, which highlighted a slight 4% year-over-year decline in net profit. Nevertheless, investor enthusiasm surged after the board announced an interim dividend of Rs 23 per share, coupled with an eye-catching 1:10 stock split.

title: Sensex jumps over 300 pts, Nifty above 25,700 after Infosys earnings push
summary: Indian markets traded higher on Friday as Infosys’ upbeat Q3 results and guidance boosted IT stocks and lifted benchmark indices. Broader sentiment stayed cautious, with analysts flagging FII selling, limited near-term triggers and global cues—including AI-driven tech momentum, crude stability and U.S. rate expectations—as key drivers for market direction.

title: Jio Financial Services shares in focus after Q3 PAT drops 9% You
summary: Shares of Jio Financial Services are set to be in focus after the company reported a 9% YoY decline in Q3FY26 net profit to Rs 269 crore. The earnings softness came despite a sharp 106% surge in operating revenue, driven by strong growth in interest and fee income, highlighting momentum in core business lines

title: Infosys shares climb 5% on FY26 guidance hike post Q3 results. Is more upside left?
summary: Infosys shares surged on Friday after the company boosted its FY26 revenue growth forecast. The IT major now expects constant-currency revenue growth between 3-3.5%. This positive outlook has led brokerages like Nomura, Elara Capital, and Emkay Global to maintain their buy or accumulate ratings. The company's ADRs also saw significant gains.

title: ONGC, Oil India and other oil-linked stocks in focus as crude slides after Iran tensions ease
summary: A sharp 4% drop in global crude has put ONGC, Oil India, Reliance, Indian Oil, BPCL and HPCL back in the spotlight. The reversal, driven by easing geopolitical fears, reshapes near-term expectations for upstream producers and refiners, with analysts watching whether oversupply or renewed tensions steer prices ahead.

title: Groww shares surge 4% on positive brokerage commentary post Q3 results. Should you buy, sell, or hold?
summary: In a surprising twist, Billionbrains Garage Ventures' stock surged on Friday despite a reported profit decline for Q3 of fiscal 2026. The notable increase in revenue, driven by market share expansion, impressed brokerages. Positive sentiments were echoed as Groww fortified its position in both stock and derivatives markets, with SIP inflows witnessing a remarkable uptick.

summary: Infosys share price has gained 5% in one month and has risen 14% in three months. The largecap IT stock has fallen 13% in one year, but has surged 24% in five years.

summary: Reliance Q3 Results 2026 LIVE: Analysts expect RIL to report a steady performance, driven by healthy growth in the oil-to-chemical (O2C) and telecom businesses. While retail segment is also expected to see decent growth, weakness in RIL’s oil and gas business is expected to persist.

summary: Cipla shares fell sharply on Friday after a halt in Lanreotide Injection production due to USFDA observations at its Greek partner. Supply is expected to resume in H1 FY27. The stock trades near oversold levels, with bearish technical indicators, amid investor concern over the limited availability of a top US product.

summary: Data centres have become an absolute necessity for tech companies that are aggressively pushing for AI to win the global race. However, power costs have surged in areas where data centres are located.

title: Yes Bank shares jump 3% ahead of Q3 results tomorrow. Here’s what investors can expect
summary: Yes Bank shares saw an uptick on Friday ahead of Q3FY26 results scheduled tomorrow. Investors are optimistic about earnings recovery, with NII and PPOP expected to improve. PAT estimates vary, with Kotak projecting a slight decline and JM Financial forecasting strong year-on-year growth.

title: South Indian Bank shares rise nearly 4% after Q3 profit growth, asset quality improves
summary: South Indian Bank shares rose nearly 4% after strong Q3 results showed profit growth, improving asset quality and robust loan expansion. Lower NPAs, stable capital adequacy and bullish technical indicators supported investor sentiment.

title: Zen Technologies rallies over 9% after bagging Rs 404 crore Defence orders
summary: On the technical front, Trendlyne data shows that Zen Tech’s 14-day Relative Strength Index (RSI) stands at 26.5. An RSI below 30 typically signals an oversold condition, suggesting the stock may have witnessed excessive selling and could be poised for a potential rebound.

title: Global money returns to US debt, lifting treasury holdings to all-time peak
summary: Foreign holdings of U.S. Treasuries hit an all-time high of $9.355 trillion in November, rebounding after the record 43-day government shutdown. Japan, the UK, and Canada led the gains, while China reduced exposure. Strong inflows reflected renewed global confidence, with Treasury and equity purchases driving a $212 billion net capital inflow.

title: Sensex surges 750 points, Nifty jumps nearly 1%: Infosys led IT rally and other factors pushing market higher today
summary: Indian equities surged on Friday, with the Sensex climbing over 750 points and Nifty topping 25,850, led by a strong rally in IT stocks. Infosys gained 5% after raising FY26 revenue guidance, lifting the Nifty IT index by 3%, while Wipro and other IT firms boosted overall market sentiment.

title: Vedanta shares halt after 12% rally in 4 days, slip 2% amid sector weakness
summary: Vedanta shares fell nearly 2% on Thursday, halting a four-day rally that saw the stock surge 12% to Rs 675.70. Profit-taking and weakness in the broader metal sector pressured the stock, while Hindalco, NMDC, Hindustan Zinc, and NALCO also traded lower amid elevated volumes and market volatility

title: Crude oil prices fall for the second day on easing fears of a US strike on Iran. What's behind the fall?
summary: Brent crude slipped 21 cents, or 0.3%, to $63.55 a barrel, while U.S. West Texas Intermediate fell 15 cents, or 0.3%, to $59.04 a barrel.

title: South Indian Bank share price soars over 6% to fresh record high on strong Q3 numbers
summary: South Indian Bank shares rose 6.4% to an all-time high of  ₹45.20 after reporting a record quarterly net profit of  ₹374.32 crore for Q3FY26, a 9.5% increase year-on-year. Retail deposits grew by 13%, while gross NPAs declined to 2.67%.

title: INR vs USD: Rupee drops amid strong dollar; 5 key reasons that may keep INR under pressure
summary: INR vs USD: The rupee depreciated by 10 paise to 90.44 against the US dollar, influenced by foreign investment outflows and a strong dollar. Despite lower crude prices and positive equity sentiment, challenges persist as the trade deficit widens and foreign investor confidence remains low.

title: Anthropic names ex-Microsoft MD Irina Ghose to head India operations
summary: AI startup Anthropic has tapped former Microsoft India managing director Irina Ghose as its first senior leader in the country, signalling its push to scale in its second-largest market.

title: Will Budget bring back FIIs? Morgan Stanley's Ridham Desai expects 3 reforms to revive foreign flows
summary: After $21 billion of sustained selling by foreign institutional investors since early 2025, market strategists are pinning hopes on the Union Budget to revive foreign inflows. Morgan Stanley’s India equity strategist Ridham Desai outlines three key capital market reforms that could help reverse the FII outflow trend and restore investor confidence in Indian equities.

title: Wipro shares rally 4% ahead of Q3 results. What are brokerages expecting?
summary: Wipro shares rose ahead of its Q3 results due later today, as investors tracked expectations of muted growth and margin pressure. Brokerages foresee flat to modest revenue improvement, aided partly by the Harman acquisition, though integration costs and furloughs may weigh on profitability. Street focus remains on guidance, deal momentum and margin outlook.

title: Shadowfax IPO opens next week; GMP indicates 12% listing gain. Check key details here
summary: Shadowfax Technologies is set to launch its Initial Public Offering (IPO) with a total issue size of Rs 1,907.27 crore. The offering consists of a fresh issue of 8.06 crore equity shares worth Rs 1,000 crore, which will be utilised to fund the company’s growth initiatives.

title: ICICI Prudential AMC shares surge 7% after Q3 PAT jumps 45% YoY
summary: ICICI Prudential AMC shares rose sharply on Friday after the company posted strong Q3 results, with profit rising 45% year-on-year to Rs 917 crore. Operating performance improved sharply, asset growth remained robust, and equity-led AUM expansion continued. The AMC also announced a dividend and reaffirmed leadership continuity with S. Naren’s reappointment.

title: Aritas Vinyl IPO Day 1: Issue subscribed 30% so far. Check GMP, issue details, more.

title: Shadowfax Technologies GMP signals 12% listing gains— 10 key things to know from the RHP ahead of IPO on Tuesday
summary: Shadowfax Technologies aims to raise  ₹1,907.27 crore through its IPO to enhance network infrastructure and fund acquisitions. The company generated  ₹2,485.13 crore in FY25, with a profit of  ₹6.43 crore. The IPO opens on January 20, with a price band of  ₹118 to  ₹124 per share.

title: Budget recap: How much income tax relief FM Nirmala Sitharaman gave taxpayers last year? What to expect in Budget 2026?
summary: In Budget 2025, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman made several announcement that came as a boon for taxpayers and salaried people. Will Budget 2026 do the same?
